intro: Hieracium crinitellum, commonly known as the curly hair hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant's hairy stems and leaves give it a distinctive appearance, and it is often found in small colonies.
